title: Missing X-XSS-Protection Header - Legacy XSS Protection Not Enabled
description: The application does not set the X-XSS-Protection header in HTTP responses. This is a legacy security mechanism supported by older browsers (Internet Explorer 8+, Chrome, Safari) to prevent reflected XSS attacks. While modern browsers rely on Content Security Policy (CSP) for XSS protection, the X-XSS-Protection header provides an additional layer of defense for users with older browsers that support this header but not CSP.
impact: Users with older browsers that support X-XSS-Protection but lack full CSP support would have reduced XSS protection capabilities. This is a minor security concern in modern web environments where CSP is the standard, but affects users on legacy browsers. The impact is negligible for most modern deployments.
evidence:
HTTP response headers analysis from http://localhost:8000/ shows:
- Server: SimpleHTTP/0.6 Python/3.13.3
- Response headers include: Server, Date, Content-type, Content-Length, Last-Modified
- X-XSS-Protection header: NOT PRESENT

POC Execution Output:
The created POC script sends a curl request to the target and analyzes response headers. Output confirms:
[âœ—] X-XSS-Protection header is MISSING
Expected header format not found: X-XSS-Protection: 1; mode=block

Test command: curl -i http://localhost:8000/ | grep -i "X-XSS-Protection"
Result: No output (header not present)
remediation:
1. Add the X-XSS-Protection header to all HTTP responses with value '1; mode=block' to enable XSS protection in legacy browsers.
2. Configure at the application framework level or reverse proxy (e.g., Apache, Nginx):
   - Apache: Add 'Header set X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"' in .htaccess or httpd.conf
   - Nginx: Add 'add_header X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block";' in server block
   - Application framework: Configure in middleware or response headers
3. Prioritize implementing and strengthening Content Security Policy (CSP) as the primary XSS defense mechanism.
4. Test header is properly set using: curl -i http://localhost:8000/ | grep -i "X-XSS-Protection"
references: OWASP - Recommended Response Headers; MDN - X-XSS-Protection (deprecated but still useful for legacy browser support); CWE-693: Protection Mechanism Failure
